Assign Fishery Sectors to U.S. West Coast Fisheries Data

get.sector.Rd

This low level helper function assigns a fishery sector to U.S. west coast fishery data, depending on the type of data supplied. See details

get.sector(X, sector, data.type)

Arguments

X

WCGOP pre-processed data set, typically OBOrig_Pre or FTOrig_Pre
sector

a character vector of length == 1 indicating a valid fishery sector name to be processed. See details for valid fishery sector names.
data.type

specifies the data source of X. See details for valid inputs.

Value

Returns the original data set with a new grouping variable, sector, which specifies the fishery sector.

Details

Fishery sectors differ from the initial FISHERY that is assigned upon data input. Multiple FISHERY codes could have the same sector assignment, e.g., sector = Nearshore will join all FISHERY = 'CA Nearshore','OR Blue-Black Rockfish Nearshore', or 'OR Blue-Black Rockfish' under the single Nearshore group.

Fishery sectors can be assigned to both the FOS Observer data (data.type = 'OB') or Pacific States Marine Fishery Commission fish ticket data (data.type = 'FT').

Valid fishery sectors include:

  • Catch Shares

  • Catch Shares EM

  • LE CA Halibut

  • Shoreside Hake

  • Midwater Hake

  • Midwater Rockfish

  • Nearshore

  • Limited Entry Trawl

  • Limited Entry Sablefish

  • LE Fixed Gear DTL

  • OA Fixed Gear

  • OA CA Halibut

  • Pink Shrimp

  • Directed P Halibut

  • Sea Cucumber

  • Ridgeback Prawn

See also

get.sector

Examples

if (FALSE) {
le_sablefish_sector <- get.sector(X = OBOrig_Pre, sector = "Limited Entry Sablefish", data.type = "OB")
}
